- Topic: Amendment of Definitions for Historic Preservation
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain sections of the City of New Orleans Code related to historic preservation, specifically regarding properties within the jurisdiction of the New Orleans Historic District and Landmarks Commission (HDLC) and the Central Business District Historic District and Landmarks Commission (CBD-HDLC). This includes revised definitions of demolition, exterior wall, obscuration, and primary facade.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,254
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Approved - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The Governmental Affairs Committee recommended approval, and the ordinance was passed with 8 YEAS.
- Tags/Keywords: Historic preservation, New Orleans Code, Governmental Affairs Committee, Definitions
- UID: 11dd0a60-dffd-4ce4-8911-7bfd0a4d404f

- Topic: Appropriation of Federal Grant Funds to Fire Department
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to amend the Operating Budget of Revenues and Expenditures for the City of New Orleans for the year 2021 to appropriate federal grant funds from Intergovernmental Transfers to the Fire Department for various grants, including the Assistance to Firefighters Grant (AFG), Fire Prevention and Safety Grant, and FY 19 Port Security Grant (PSGP).
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,255 and CAL. NO. 33,256
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Approved - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT) for CAL. NO. 33,255
  Vote 2: Approved - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT) for CAL. NO. 33,256
- Decision/Key Actions: The Budget Committee recommended approval, and both ordinances were passed with 7 YEAS each.
- Tags/Keywords: Federal grant funds, Operating Budget, Fire Department, Budget Committee
- UID: 11dd0a60-dffd-4ce4-8911-7bfd0a4d404f

- Topic: Amendment of Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance for Child Care Centers
- Summary: Motion M-21-112 directed the City Planning Commission to hold a public hearing to consider amending the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance to allow child care centers in specific residential zoning districts.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-112
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Motion passed, directing the City Planning Commission to hold a public hearing for potential amendments to zoning ordinance.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning Ordinance, Child Care Centers, City Planning Commission
- UID: bc255dd1-d128-4f88-8c84-a31af1b38be4

- Topic: Designation of "Safe Exchange Zones" by the New Orleans Police Department
- Summary: Resolution R-21-114 urged the New Orleans Police Department to designate clearly marked "Safe Exchange Zones" in public areas at district stations, providing a safe space for legal transactions from online marketplaces.
- Ordinance Number: R-21-114
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Resolution passed, urging the New Orleans Police Department to designate "Safe Exchange Zones" at district stations.
- Tags/Keywords: Safe Exchange Zones, New Orleans Police Department, Resolution
- UID: bc255dd1-d128-4f88-8c84-a31af1b38be4

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Motion M-21-113
- Summary: The motion directed the City Planning Commission to hold a public hearing to consider amending the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance of the City of New Orleans, specifically to modify the Neighborhood Participation Program (NPP) requirements to allow for teleconferencing, virtual, or other remote meeting formats during a declared emergency by the Governor or Mayor when in-person meetings are not an available option.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-113
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion passed, directing the City Planning Commission to proceed with the public hearing to consider the proposed amendments to the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance.
- Tags/Keywords: Motion, City Planning Commission, Zoning Ordinance, Neighborhood Participation Program
- UID: 90b20037-fa57-4e0b-b0f9-c90a243221fd
